description.p: An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce mystical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away. Alchemy is the oldest of artificer traditions, and its versatility has long been valued during times of war and peace.
You gain proficiency with tinkerer's tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan’s tools of your choice.

You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Tinkerer Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

Beginning at 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest, anytime you add an infusion to nonmagical item or object, you can choose to add two infusions onto that object, but instead of it being magical indefinitely, when the item is used for a check or attack more than 5 times, the object will lose both of its infusions and needs to be reapplied when you finish a long rest.
When you are infusing multiple items during you rest, if you are double infusing, then means you can only infuse half rounded down the amount of the maximum amount of items you can infuse.
Maximum number of objects you can infuse is {{magical tinkering:objects}}.

sheet.description: whenever you finish a long rest, anytime you add an infusion to nonmagical item or object, you can choose to add two infusions onto that object. When you are infusing multiple items during you rest, if you are double infusing, then means you can only infuse half rounded down the amount of the maximum amount of items you can infuse. Maximum number of objects you can infuse is {{magical tinkering:objects}}.

description.p: You've developed masterful command of magical chemicals, enhancing the healing and damage you create through them. Whenever you cast a spell using your alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore hit points or be a damage roll that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, and the bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

sheet.description: Whenever you cast a spell using your alchemist’s supplies, you gain a +{{alchemical savant:bonus}} bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore hit points or be a damage roll that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage.

description.p: You can incorporate restorative reagents into some of your works:

ul.li: Whenever a creature drinks an experimental elixir you created, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to 2d6 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point).

You can cast lesser restoration without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you use alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Whenever a creature drinks an experimental elixir you created, the creature gains 2d6+{{intelligence:modifier}} temporary hp. You can cast lesser restoration {{restorative reagents:usage}} times per long rest without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you use alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus.

description.p: You have been exposed to so many chemicals that they pose little risk to you, and you can use them to quickly end certain ailments:

ul.li: You gain resistance to acid damage and poison damage, and you are immune to the poisoned condition.

You can cast greater restoration and heal without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without material components, provided you use alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus. Once you cast either spell with this feature, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You are immune to the poisoned condition. You can cast greater restoration and heal once per long rest without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without material components, provided you use alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus.
